headline.main: A German Controversy: What To Do? Bavaria Has Some Strict Ideas

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TO the accompaniment of a sensational and sometimes anguished debate, the southern state of Bavaria last month put into effect some of the stiffest AIDS regulations yet ordered anywhere in the world, including mandatory blood tests for prostitutes, drug addicts, prison inmates, applicants for civil-service jobs and some foreigners seeking residence in Bavaria.

headline.main: A CLASSIC EXAMPLE OF DIETING GONE AWRY

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Kitty Dukakis was addicted to amphetamines for a quarter of a century, but experts say the doses she has described probably caused no significant permanent damage.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Kitty Dukakis was addicted to amphetamines for a quarter of a century, but experts say the doses she has described probably caused no significant permanent damage.
